Posts.Content: Jun 24, 2013 09:52AM CJ_73 wrote: I made it through the weekend. I tried to keep busy but honestly, I think I did more worrying and crying than anything else. I have two girls, ages 8 and 9 and I'm so fearful for them. Sitting at work and can't concentrate. Sort of feel like I'm losing it.
Posts.Title: Test, wait, drink wine. Repeat. CJ_73 beacon800

Posts.Content: Jun 25, 2013 01:09PM CJ_73 wrote: Thanks Mags....yes birad 4. I had my biopsy this morning and now the waiting begins again.... I did fine with the local and the first biopsy. The second one was painful. We took a break, another local and the third biopsy. They put the clips in mark the areas. I didn't expect the post biopsy mammogram. I guess it was fine since I was so numb but really?? What I also didn't expect was the US tech telling me it would be fine because she didn't see anything. That's twice she's said that and *shockingly* the Doctor has come in and showed her the areas of concern. Why are people like that?? Took the day off of work & enjoying an ice pack. Trying to make it to Thursday afternoon when the results will be in.
Posts.Title: Test, wait, drink wine. Repeat. CJ_73 beacon800

Posts.Content: CJ_73 wrote: Trying to keep some sort of sense of humor during this but.......well, you know. Turned 40 in May and went for my mammogram 6/10. They called me back as they saw a density. Had a second mammogram and ultrasound 6/13. Radiologist said he isn't comfortable giving the all clear as the density remains and my family history is "scary." (Mom had two types of breast cancer and diagnosed at age 52, Grandma, Aunt, 1st cousin diagnosed in early 40's and a second cousin - all on my Mom's side. My Dad is Eastern European Jewish and has prostate cancer. Even he isn't doing me any favors....). Had a MRI 6/18 and received the call today that they found an additional area of concern. I wanted to vomit. Going back for another ultrasound and possible biopsy 6/25. Realized I have never received any of the reports and not happy that I received the MRI results from someone in the office....not the doctor. What? Who does that? The radiologist who read the MRI will be doing the ultrasound on Tuesday. I don't think I'm comfortable not doing a biopsy. Otherwise I think I'll worry until the next mammogram and wondering if I did the right thing. I'm also waiting for the results of the BRCA testing. Trying to keep busy so I make it through the coming days. Sick of everyone telling me not to worry. And if I hear the words "oh, I can only imagine" one more time.....I started reading this site and you all know. You get it. Just needed to vent to a group who understand. Wish we all didn't though. Hugs to all who are in the same boat. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Test, wait, drink wine. Repeat. CJ_73 beacon800

Posts.Content: Jun 24, 2013 01:24PM CJ_73 wrote: Tomorrow is the follow up ultrasound and biopsy. They say 48 hours for the results so will know by the end of the week (God willing....). I had them faxÂ me my mammogram, ultrasound and MRI reports. Three areas of concern. I had to stop Googling the terms as I'm a little wigged out. Appreciate the support of you ladies....

Posts.Content: Jun 26, 2013 06:42PM CJ_73 wrote: Thanks all for the replies and support....it means a lot. I'm trying to stay busy but find that there are moments where I just lose it. I came to work today and just feel so unfocused, which is so unlike me. I know I have good reason to not mentally be with it but it's frustrating. Keeping a sense of humor about all this is kind of getting old....the waiting is just miserable. Plus I have this ridiculous hot pink sports bra on today....and I'm sore as heck. I took some Advil but it's not helping much. I'm supposed to call in tomorrow afternoon and get my results. Is this how it's done elsewhere?
